alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Madison; Tensas (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 12:46AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Tensas, southern Madison and Franklin Parishes through 115 AM CDT... At 1245 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Newlight, or 12 miles east of Winnsboro, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Newlight around 1250 AM CDT. Newellton and Somerset around 100 AM CDT. Afton around 105 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Gilbert and Baskin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northeastern Louisiana...and southwestern and west central Mississippi.
